alert.note: Alert for East Marshall; East Polk; Grant; Mahnomen; Pennington; Red Lake; Roseau; West Becker; West Otter Tail (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 01 at 2:36PM CDT until May 02 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Grand Forks has issued a Fire Weather Watch for Near Critical to Critical fire weather conditions, which is in effect from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Parts of west central and northwest Minnesota. * TIMING...This afternoon and evening, from noon to 8pm. * WINDS...North 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Less than 30 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the 50s. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite may spread rapidly and become difficult to control.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
